task.title: Seasoning a Cast Iron Pan
task.shortdesc: Properly seasoning your cast iron pan forms a protective layer on its surface, preventing rust and enhacing its non-stick properties.

taskbody.prereq: prereq Thoroughly clean your cast iron pan with hot water and a gentle scrubbing brush, ensuring all food residue and previous seasoning layers are removed.

step.cmd: Apply a thin layer of oil such as vegetable oil or flaxeed oil to the entire surface of the pan including the handle.
Place the oiled pan upside down in a preheated oven at 375 degrees Farenheight and bake for one hour.
Let the pan cool in the oven before removing.
step.info: For detailed instructions and additional tips on seasoning cast iron pans, refer to the manufacturer's guidelines or trusted culinary resources such as "The Cast Iron Skillet Cookbook" by Sharon Kramis and Julie Kramis Hearne.
